title: Dizzy Gillespie - Verve/Phillips Small Group Sessions (1954-63)
description:
DISCOGRAPHY 
(A) Dizzy Gillespie (tp, vcl-1), Hank Mobley (ts), Wade Legge (p), Lou Hackney (b), Charlie Persip (d). 
Fine Sound, NYC, May 25, 1954 
1716-3 Sugar Hips Norgran MGN 1083, Verve MGV 8173 
1717-2 Hey Pete (Let's Eat More Meat -1 Norgran 116 (78), MGN 1083, Verve MGV 8173 
1718-2 One Alone (Lonely One) - MGN 18, 1050, Verve MGV 8141 
1719-1 Money Honey -1 Norgran MGN 1083, Verve MGV 8173 
Same as above except add Jimmy Cleveland (tb) -1. 
Fine Sound, NYC, June 8, 1954 
1756-2 Blue Mood -1 Norgran 135 (78), MGN 1083, Verve MGV 8173 
1757-2 Rails -1 - - - 
1758-6 Devil And The Flesh -1,2 Norgran 140 (78) - - 
1759-2 Rumbola - - - 
-1 Devil and the Flesh has been issued as Devil and the Fish on all previous issues. 
_______________________________________________________ 
(B) Dizzy Gillespie (tp), Henry Coker (tb), Gigi Gryce (as, arr), Benny Golson (ts, arr), Pee Wee Moore (bari), Ray Bryant (p), Tommy Bryant (b), Charlie Persip (d). 
Nola Studios, NYC, December 17, 1957 
21849 Blues After Dark (BG-arr) Verve MGV 8352 
21850 Sea Breeze (BG-arr) - 
21851 Out Of The Past (BG-arr) - 
21852 Shabozz (GG-arr) - 
21853 Reminiscing (GG-arr) - 
21854 A Night At Tony's (GG-arr) - 
21855 Smoke Signals (GG-arr) - 
21856 Just By Myself (BG-arr) - 
________________________________________________________________________ 
(C) Dizzy Gillespie (tp, vcl-1), Junior Mance (p), Les Spann (g, fl-2), Sam Jones (b), Lex Humphries (d). 
Columbia 30th Street Studio, NYC, February 17, 1959 
22711-5 Girl Of My Dreams Verve VS-68328 
22712-8 My Man Verve VS-68313 
22713-3 Moon Glow -2 -

22714-5 There Is No Greater Love Verve VS-68313 
22715-1 Oo-Shoo-Be-Doo-Be -1 previously unissued 
22716-2 St. Louis Blues Verve VS-68313 
Same 
Columbia 30th Street Studio, NYC, February 18, 1959 
22717-3 I Found A Million Dollar Baby (alt) -2 Verve (CD) 549744-2 
22717-5 I Found A Million Dollar Baby -2 Verve VS-68313 
22718-1 Swing Low Sweet Cadillac -1 Verve VS-68328 
22719-3 Always Verve VS-68313 
22720-1 Willow Weep For Me Verve VS-68328 
22721-5 Umbrella Man -1 - 
22722-1 My Heart Belongs To Daddy Verve VS-68313 
Same 
Columbia 30th Street Studio, NYC, February 20, 1959 
22723-1 Constantinople -2 Verve VS-68328 
22724-1 Wrap Your Troubles In Dreams Verve VS-68313 
22725-2 Woody'n You -3 - 
22726-2 Lorraine (omit p, b) -3 Verve VS-68328 
22727-5 Ungawa -3 Verve VS-68328 
22728-10 Squatty Roo -4 Verve (CD) 314 521 857-2 
-3 add Francisco "Chino" Pozo 
-4 add Johnny Hodges (as) 
Note: All discographies have listed Carlos "Potato" Valdes as the conga player on the February 20th session, which is quite inexplicable since Verve MGV 8328 clearly states that it is Francisco "Chino" Pozo. 
________________________________________________________________________ 
(D) Dizzy Gillespie (tp, vcl-1), Leo Wright (fl, as), Junior Mance (p), Art Davis (b), Teddy Stewart (d). 
Ter Mar Studios, Chicago, March 28-29, 1960 
26600-17 Theme From Formula 409 (Pt. 1) Verve 10213 
26601-14 Theme From Formula 409 (Pt. 2) - 
26602-7 Kush (Pt.1) previously unissued 
26603-1 Kush (Pt.2) - 
26604-7 Goin' Fishin' -1 - 
26605/6 Medley - 
____________________________________________________ 
(E) Dizzy Gillespie (tp), Hank Jones (p), George Duvivier (b), Charlie Persip (d) 
NYC April 28, 1960 
26752 Things Ain't What They Used To Be Verve MGV8386 
Note: The rest of this session is by a 15-piece studio orchestra _________________________________________ 
(F) Dizzy Gillespie (tp, vcl-1), Leo Wright (fl, as), Lalo Schifrin (p), Bob Cummingham (b), Chuck Lampkin (d). 
The Museum Of Modern Art, NYC, February 9, 1961 
61VK257 Kush Verve VS-68401 
61VK258 Salt Peanuts -1 - 
61VK259 The Mooche - 
61VK260 A Night In Tunisia - 
Note: Six more tunes were supposedly performed at the concert, some of which may have included Candido Camero, but no tape of these has survived. 
__________________________________________________ 
(G) Dizzy Gillespie (tp), Leo Wright (as, fl), Charlie Ventura -1 (ts, bass sax), Lalo Schifrin (p), Chris White (b), Rudy Collins (d), Jose Paula -2 (g, tamb, perc vcl), Carmen Costa -3 (cabasa, guiro, vcl). 
NYC, May 1962

(Give Me Some Money There)-3 previously unissued

-2 includes band vocal 
-3 includes band vocal, add Jose Paula, Carmen Costa (vcl, maracas). 
-4 add Jose Paula (g), Paula or Carmen Costa (vcl). Costa, Leo Wright and Lalo Schifrin are probably playing the percussion on this track.
